comment.author: 72396230@N00
comment._content:
Barbara, those big radial engines would hold up to fifty gallons of oil, and they used a lot of oil every hour of operation.  It'd be tire some to fill it a quart at time.  These motors were 'dry sump', with a separate oil tank usually located behind the engine itself.

That would not be a good place for a fuel cap, because it's so close to the very hot engine.
